meanings.definition: A small Old World woodpecker with a characteristic habit of twisting its neck.
meanings.sent1: The wrynecks in the forest have a unique way of twisting their necks to find insects.
meanings.sent2: I saw a wrynecks perched on a tree, twisting its neck in search of food.
meanings.sent3: The wrynecks decided to have a neck-twisting competition for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves were as graceful as a wrynecks twisting its neck to catch prey.
meanings.sent5: The wrynecks' neck-twisting behavior is fascinating to observe in the wild.

meanings.definition: A person who is deceitful or cunning.
meanings.sent1: Beware of the wrynecks in the group; they may try to deceive you with their words.
meanings.sent2: The wrynecks in the story always had a hidden agenda up their sleeves.
meanings.sent3: The wrynecks at the office were always plotting something mischievous.
meanings.sent4: She navigated the tricky situation with the skill of a wrynecks outsmarting its prey.
meanings.sent5: The wrynecks' cunning ways were finally exposed during the investigation.

meanings.definition: To twist or turn something in a wry or ironic manner.
meanings.sent1: He wrynecks his words to make them sound more interesting.
meanings.sent2: She wrynecks the truth to avoid hurting others' feelings.
meanings.sent3: The comedian wrynecks his jokes to keep the audience laughing.
meanings.sent4: The plot of the movie wrynecks unexpectedly, leaving the audience surprised.
meanings.sent5: She wrynecks her hair into a stylish bun before going out.
